treks.title: Mardi Himal Trek
treks.short_description: Less crowded alternative to popular treks with stunning close-up views of Machapuchare and Annapurna peaks. Trek through pristine forests, rhododendron groves, and high alpine meadows at the foot of Mardi Himal.
treks.review_text: Hidden gem trek with incredible mountain views and fewer crowds. Direct views of Machapuchare and Annapurna - less popular but equally stunning.

hero_section.title: Mardi Himal Trek
hero_section.subtitle: Less crowded trek with close-up Annapurna views at 4,500m

sections.heading: Mardi Himal Trek Overview
articles: Mardi Himal Trek is a hidden gem in the Annapurna region, offering stunning close-up views of Machapuchare and Annapurna peaks with significantly fewer crowds than Poon Hill or ABC treks. This 6-day trek starts from Pokhara and takes you through pristine forests, rhododendron groves, and high alpine meadows to Mardi Himal viewpoint at 4,500m. The trek offers excellent mountain photography opportunities, authentic village experiences, and some of the region's most breathtaking panoramic views. Unlike popular trekking routes, Mardi Himal remains relatively untouched and less commercialized, offering true wilderness experience.

bullets.text: Less crowded than Poon Hill and ABC treks
Max altitude 4,500m - higher views of Annapurna and Machapuchare
6 days total - good balance of time and experience

itinerary_days.title: Arrive Pokhara from Kathmandu
itinerary_days.description: Drive or fly from Kathmandu to Pokhara. Rest and trek preparation.

itinerary_days.title: Trek Pokhara to Dhampus via Sarangkot
itinerary_days.description: Trek from Pokhara uphill through Sarangkot forest to Dhampus village with first views of Annapurna and Machapuchare.

itinerary_days.title: Trek Dhampus to Pothana
itinerary_days.description: Trek through rhododendron forests and villages to Pothana village at higher altitude. Excellent mountain views.

itinerary_days.title: Trek Pothana to Forest Camp
itinerary_days.description: Trek through dense rhododendron and oak forests to Forest Camp at high altitude. Wildlife spotting opportunities.

itinerary_days.title: Trek Forest Camp to Mardi Himal Viewpoint
itinerary_days.description: Final ascent to Mardi Himal viewpoint (4,500m). Stunning close-up views of Machapuchare, Annapurna, and high alpine scenery. Return to Forest Camp.

itinerary_days.title: Trek Forest Camp to Pokhara
itinerary_days.description: Descend to Pokhara. Trek completion celebration.

highlights.title: Mardi Himal Viewpoint - Close-up Mountain Views
highlights.description: Reach Mardi Himal at 4,500m for stunning close-up views of Machapuchare (Fish Tail) and Annapurna peaks. Excellent for photography with fewer crowds.

highlights.title: Less Crowded Alternative
highlights.description: Unlike popular Poon Hill and ABC treks, Mardi Himal remains relatively untouched. Authentic experience without commercial trekking infrastructure.

highlights.title: Pristine Forest Trekking
highlights.description: Trek through dense rhododendron and oak forests with incredible biodiversity. Spring season offers spectacular wildflower blooms.

highlights.title: Wilderness Experience
highlights.description: Higher altitude alpine meadows and glacial terrain. True mountain wilderness with minimal infrastructure.

cost_and_date_section.intro_text: Mardi Himal Trek best March-May (spring) and September-November (autumn). Private departures available on request. Less crowded option for Annapurna region exploration.

date_highlights.highlight: Autumn (Sept-Nov): Stable weather, crystal-clear mountain views

questions.question: Why is Mardi Himal less crowded?
questions.answer: Mardi Himal is off the main trekking circuit. Fewer tourists know about it compared to Poon Hill. Higher altitude (4,500m) means fewer casual trekkers.

questions.question: Is altitude acclimatization needed?
questions.answer: Yes. Maximum altitude 4,500m requires proper acclimatization and good fitness. Gradual ascent helps prevent altitude sickness.

questions.question: Best season for this trek?
questions.answer: Spring (March-May) for wildflower blooms and autumn (September-November) for clear mountain views. Winter can be very cold at high altitude.

additional_info_sections.heading: Why Choose Mardi Himal?
articles: Less crowded than mainstream trekking routes. Authentic wilderness experience without commercial infrastructure.
Higher altitude (4,500m) provides better views of Annapurna and Machapuchare than lower altitude treks.
6 days is good balance - not too short, not too long. Fits vacation schedules well.
Pristine forests and alpine meadows offer incredible photography opportunities.

bullets.text: Less crowded alternative to popular Poon Hill
Moderate difficulty with good mountain views
